content.raw:
Good question, @iche033 . Let me give some more context: 

In portal we use _.extend, which extends only at the first level , this means that if at portal you have { a: xxx, b: yyy} and it receives a { c: zzz } it will extend the original object and result in { a, b, c} . But if the incoming data is { b: 111} then it will override whatever previously existed at portal's b property.  
We then have 2 options: 1) extend "b" at the client level and always send it complete.  Or 2) do a "recursive/deep extend" at portal .  I didn't find this type of recursive extend in "underscore" library (although there are some npm modules that we could download and use) .

Do you have a preference to go with 2) approach ?
